reviews.review_msg: If you think you know yourself, you don't. Take this class, she will teach you your role and purpose in life.
AH-MA-ZING! This course is an experience, not a class.

Candyce is a professor unlike any other. She will break you down and build you back up into the person you should be. While she will challenge every single thing that you know, you will come out of her class prepared to handle absolutely any challenge you will ever encounter.
Really good prof, amazing lectures, but presentations every week.

She forces you to be more critical . Its not a typical political course upper division course at sfu . She forces use to be more critical when it comes to presentations and term paper . It was wonderful learning from her . Taking her class would actually help you in real life .

This is one of the best classes I have taken in a long time. She is very knowledgeable and is the only prof who has held my attention for the entirety of the class. A group presentation every week but you gain better speaking skills as well as learn how to think critically. Would definitely take another class with her!

This class pushed me to be critical, and analytical more then I ever thought I could. You have to work extremely hard, and there is a presentation everyday. But you gain public speaking skills, and skills that help in a work environment. If you dont work well in a group this class isnt for you. Very rewarding, but get ready to work harder then ever

Eccentric and personal. Extremely knowledgable and experienced in the advanced intelligence field. Class is very challenging but so rewarding. Basically half of each seminar is a workshop for critical thinking, public speaking and professional/inter-personal skills. The personal improvements and character you build in this class will blow you away.

She is not like any other prof I've had before. She will challenge you and push you outside of your comfort zone. She cares about each student and shows that she genuinely wants us to improve. Her lectures are interesting and she makes sure to keep everyone engaged. Lots of presentations and group work. You will definitely gain valuable skills.
Will keep you engaged with presentations and real-world examples. Makes sure you're always thinking critically. This class has value beyond the course content itself.
real world prof. knows what shes on about

She is extremely knowledgeable and the readings she has selected were exceptional for understanding the intelligence world both past and present. She is also very caring about her students and strives to ensure everyone takes something of value away at the end of the course. Definitely take this course and give it your all and you will be rewarded!

Candyce is awesome, makes you  think critically and engage you to be involved in class discussion and team work. You could learn useful materials that you may not found in other classes. The trick to be successful in her is to be on time and participate in class activities. Fair marker. I would defiantly take class with her again.
Really makes you work hard for your grade. Lecture style really helped me become more analytical. This class definitely more than any others elevated my writing and research capabilities.

Prof. Kelshall stands out for her devotion to student's individual development. She emphasized critical thinking and presentation skills, both of which have already improved my performance in other courses.   Her experience within the intelligence field added great insight to the contemporary issues taught in the course.  Definitely recommended!

Professor Kelshall is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, which she reflects in her lectures and continual effort to make you think critically and analytically. In-class and group participation is very important in order to be successful in this class. Grading and assignments can be unclear at times. Definitely recommend!

If you really want to learn, there is a lot to take away from this class. Kelshall gives you a new perspective and makes you think critically helpful for future courses. Lots of in class presentations to help you prepare for your groups actual presentation which is nice. The grading for this class is sometimes confusing but overall would recommend!

I found her very confusing. She is interactive with the class, but all over the map with her lectures and assignments. To be frank even though she is very knowledge and has the desire to be a great teacher I honestly have not learned that much. The class does have a lot of potential though
